title: For this St. Lucian runner, the Boston Marathon is ‘nothing short of a dream’
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Ava Fevrier, aiming for a six-star finish, will represent St. Lucia in the 2026 Boston Marathon.
Fevrier, based in New York City, runs for the Lingzi Foundation after initially struggling to qualify.
The runner holds the St. Lucian female national record in marathon distance, inspired by overcoming childhood hardships.

title: Actor Henry Winkler named Emerson College’s 2026 commencement speaker
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Henry Winkler, Emerson College alumnus, will be the 2026 commencement speaker at Emerson's ceremony on May 9 at the Wang Theatre.
Winkler, known for his role as Fonzie on 'Happy Days', has an acclaimed career in TV, film, and writing.
He advocates for children with dyslexia, co-writing the accessible Hank Zipzer book series, inspired by his personal experience with dyslexia.

title: Score 20% off JetBlue flights to 3 destinations from Boston with Squares4Fares
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: JetBlue offers 20% off flights from Boston through its Squares4Fares sale, valid until February 10.
Discounted destinations include Fort Lauderdale, Daytona Beach, and Phoenix; Bozeman-to-Boston is also part of the sale.
Travel must be completed by March 18, excluding Friday and Sunday flights, with one promo code per booking.

title: State Police academy supervisor and 3 instructors charged with manslaughter in death of recruit
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Enrique Delgado-Garcia died from injuries during unauthorized sparring at Massachusetts State Police academy in 2024.
Sgt. Jennifer Penton and Troopers Edwin Rodriguez, David Montanez, Casey LaMonte charged with involuntary manslaughter.
Academy suspended boxing training; International Association of Chiefs of Police reviewing Massachusetts State Police practices.

title: OpenTable names 2 Massachusetts restaurants among the most romantic in the U.S.
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Sorellina in Boston and Pellana Steakhouse in Peabody named among OpenTable's Top 100 Romantic Restaurants in the U.S.
Sorellina features Italian-Mediterranean cuisine with a focus on seafood and pastas in a formal Back Bay setting.
Pellana Steakhouse in Peabody offers a traditional steakhouse experience with prime cuts, steakhouse sides, and a notable wine selection.

title: New on Netflix and more: Top streaming picks for February 2026
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Netflix adds 'Ex Machina,' 'Hell or High Water,' and 'You've Got Mail' to its streaming lineup for February 2026.
Catherine O'Hara's notable performances in 'A Mighty Wind,' 'Home Alone,' and 'Schitt's Creek' are available on various platforms.
HBO's 'The Pitt' and Netflix's 'People You Meet on Vacation' feature as top staff picks for February 2026 streaming.

title: What the Patriots need to do in the off-season, according to readers
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Readers emphasized improving the Patriots' offensive line following their Super Bowl LX loss to the Seattle Seahawks.
79% of 163 poll respondents were unsurprised by the loss, citing offensive line issues.
Suggestions included acquiring a top-quality wide receiver and bolstering the defensive line and linebackers.

title: Springfield dry sausage plant to close, cutting 190 jobs
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Smithfield Foods will close its Springfield dry sausage plant by August, resulting in 190 job losses.
The closure follows a $140,000 EPA settlement over alleged Clean Air Act violations concerning anhydrous ammonia.
Production will move to other Smithfield plants, with the nearest facility located in New Jersey.

title: What Stefon Diggs said about his Patriots future
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Stefon Diggs plans to stay with the Patriots next season but acknowledges the decision isn't solely his.
Diggs, 32, signed a three-year $69 million contract, leading the Patriots with 85 catches for 1,013 yards.
He faces charges of assault and strangulation from an alleged incident; Patriots have expressed their support.

title: Prosecutor who tried Brian Walshe for murder enters Norfolk DA race
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Norfolk County prosecutor Greg Connor enters the race for District Attorney following a successful murder trial involving Brian Walshe.
Connor, who has spent 25 years in the DA’s office, aims to bring his experience and vision to the Norfolk DA's office.
Connor's candidacy follows Michael Morrissey's announcement not to seek reelection, joining other Democrats in the race for the position.
